airneisDescription: (“furniture” in Scottish Gaelic) is a Scottish company, and we are retailers of furniture designed by Scottish designers.
passion: So far, we have shared our passion for furniture by selling exceptional pieces through mail order and via partnerships with local stores.
digitalEra: Today, ÀIRNEIS is set to dive into the digital age by creating its own e-commerce solution to reach an international clientele as well as more deeply the one we already have locally.
missionDescription: At ÀIRNEIS, our mission is to provide high-quality furniture designed by talented Scottish designers to a global clientele. We are committed to delivering exceptional customer service and creating a smooth and enjoyable online shopping experience.
qualityDescription: We offer only the highest quality furniture.
designDescription: Each piece we sell is carefully designed by renowned Scottish designers.
serviceDescription: We pride ourselves on providing top-notch customer service.
sustainabilityDescription: We are committed to promoting sustainable practices in everything we do.
siteUsageConditionsContent: Welcome to the ÀIRNEIS site. By accessing this site, you agree to be bound by these terms of use, all applicable laws and regulations, and agree that you are responsible for compliance with all applicable local laws. If you do not agree with these terms, you are prohibited from using or accessing this site.
intellectualPropertyContent1: The content of the site, including but not limited to, texts, graphics, images, logos, and software, is the exclusive property of ÀIRNEIS or its licensors and is protected by copyright and other intellectual property laws.
intellectualPropertyContent2: Reproduction and/or representation of the Site's elements is only permitted for informational purposes for strictly personal and private use. Commercial use of these elements is prohibited unless prior authorization is obtained from ÀIRNEIS.
intellectualPropertyContent3: Failure to comply with this prohibition constitutes an infringement that may result in civil and criminal liability of the infringer, against whom ÀIRNEIS reserves the right to seek compensation for all damages.
siteUsageContent: You are authorized to use this site only for legal purposes and in accordance with these terms of use. You agree not to use this site in a way that could damage the site or impair the availability or accessibility of the site.
limitationOfLiabilityContent: Under no circumstances shall ÀIRNEIS or its suppliers be liable for damages (including, without limitation, damages for loss of data or profit, or due to business interruption) arising from the use or inability to use the materials on the ÀIRNEIS website.
termsModificationsContent: ÀIRNEIS may revise these terms of use for its website at any time without notice. By using this website, you agree to be bound by the current version of these terms of use.
applicableLawContent: Any claims relating to the ÀIRNEIS website shall be governed by the laws of Scotland without regard to its conflict of law provisions.
identificationContent1: The site www.airneis.com (hereinafter referred to as the ‘Site’) is published by:
headquarters: Headquarters: 123 Rue de l'Écosse, Edinburgh, Scotland
contactMail: Email address to contact us: airneis.commerce@gmail.com
personalDataContent1: ÀIRNEIS ensures that users' data is processed to guarantee an appropriate level of security. Personal data is not kept longer than necessary.
personalDataContent2: Collected data may be passed on to service providers, suppliers, and/or partners of ÀIRNEIS solely for the purposes related to their tasks. ÀIRNEIS takes measures to ensure their confidentiality and integrity through appropriate legal frameworks.
personalDataContent3: Each person has the right to access, rectify, object to, delete, and transfer their personal data and can determine the fate of their data after their death by email to the following address: airneis.commerce@gmail.com or by mail to the Data Protection Officer at the following address: 123 Rue de l'Écosse, Edinburgh, Scotland. The Site is also designed to be particularly attentive to the needs of its Users.
